name: USCoreProcedureProfile
title: US Core Procedure Profile
description: The US Core Procedure Profile is based upon the core FHIR Procedure Resource and meets the U.S. Core Data for Interoperability (USCDI) v2 'Procedures' requirements. This profile sets minimum expectations for the Procedure resource to record, search, and fetch procedures associated with a patient to promote interoperability and adoption through common implementation.  It identifies which core elements, extensions, vocabularies, and value sets **SHALL** be present in the resource and constrains the way the elements are used when using this profile.  It provides the floor for standards development for specific use cases.

elements.name: id
elements.description: The logical id of the resource, as used in the URL for the resource. Once assigned, this value never changes.

elements.name: meta
elements.description: The metadata about the resource. This is content that is maintained by the infrastructure. Changes to the content might not always be associated with version changes to the resource.

constraints.human: All FHIR elements must have a @value or children

elements.name: implicitRules
elements.short: A set of rules under which this content was created
elements.description: A reference to a set of rules that were followed when the resource was constructed, and which must be understood when processing the content. Often, this is a reference to an implementation guide that defines the special rules along with other profiles etc.

constraints.human: All FHIR elements must have a @value or children

elements.name: language
elements.description: The base language in which the resource is written.

constraints.human: All FHIR elements must have a @value or children

elements.name: text
elements.short: Text summary of the resource, for human interpretation
elements.description: A human-readable narrative that contains a summary of the resource and can be used to represent the content of the resource to a human. The narrative need not encode all the structured data, but is required to contain sufficient detail to make it "clinically safe" for a human to just read the narrative. Resource definitions may define what content should be represented in the narrative to ensure clinical safety.

constraints.human: All FHIR elements must have a @value or children

elements.name: contained
elements.description: These resources do not have an independent existence apart from the resource that contains them - they cannot be identified independently, and nor can they have their own independent transaction scope.

elements.name: extension
elements.description: May be used to represent additional information that is not part of the basic definition of the resource. To make the use of extensions safe and manageable, there is a strict set of governance  applied to the definition and use of extensions. Though any implementer can define an extension, there is a set of requirements that SHALL be met as part of the definition of the extension.

constraints.human: All FHIR elements must have a @value or children
Must have either extensions or value[x], not both

elements.name: modifierExtension
elements.description:
May be used to represent additional information that is not part of the basic definition of the resource and that modifies the understanding of the element that contains it and/or the understanding of the containing element's descendants. Usually modifier elements provide negation or qualification. To make the use of extensions safe and manageable, there is a strict set of governance applied to the definition and use of extensions. Though any implementer is allowed to define an extension, there is a set of requirements that SHALL be met as part of the definition of the extension. Applications processing a resource are required to check for modifier extensions.

Modifier extensions SHALL NOT change the meaning of any elements on Resource or DomainResource (including cannot change the meaning of modifierExtension itself).

constraints.human: All FHIR elements must have a @value or children
Must have either extensions or value[x], not both

elements.name: identifier
elements.description: Business identifiers assigned to this procedure by the performer or other systems which remain constant as the resource is updated and is propagated from server to server.

constraints.human: All FHIR elements must have a @value or children

mapping.map: Some combination of ORC-2 / ORC-3 / OBR-2 / OBR-3 / IPC-1 / IPC-2 / IPC-3 / IPC-4

elements.name: instantiatesCanonical
elements.description: The URL pointing to a FHIR-defined protocol, guideline, order set or other definition that is adhered to in whole or in part by this Procedure.

constraints.human: All FHIR elements must have a @value or children

elements.name: instantiatesUri
elements.description: The URL pointing to an externally maintained protocol, guideline, order set or other definition that is adhered to in whole or in part by this Procedure.

constraints.human: All FHIR elements must have a @value or children

elements.name: basedOn
elements.description: A reference to a resource that contains details of the request for this procedure.

constraints.human: All FHIR elements must have a @value or children

mapping.map: .outboundRelationship[typeCode=FLFS].target[classCode=(various e.g. PROC, OBS, PCPR, ACT,  moodCode=RQO].code

elements.name: partOf
elements.description: A larger event of which this particular procedure is a component or step.

constraints.human: All FHIR elements must have a @value or children

elements.name: status
elements.short: (USCDI) preparation | in-progress | not-done | on-hold | stopped | completed | entered-in-error | unknown
elements.description: A code specifying the state of the procedure. Generally, this will be the in-progress or completed state.

constraints.human: All FHIR elements must have a @value or children

elements.name: statusReason
elements.description: Captures the reason for the current state of the procedure.

binding.description: A code that identifies the reason a procedure was not performed.

constraints.human: All FHIR elements must have a @value or children

elements.name: category
elements.description: A code that classifies the procedure for searching, sorting and display purposes (e.g. "Surgical Procedure").

binding.description: A code that classifies a procedure for searching, sorting and display purposes.

constraints.human: All FHIR elements must have a @value or children

elements.name: code
elements.description: The specific procedure that is performed. Use text if the exact nature of the procedure cannot be coded (e.g. "Laparoscopic Appendectomy").

binding.description: Codes describing the type of  Procedure

constraints.human: All FHIR elements must have a @value or children

elements.name: subject
elements.short: (USCDI) Who the procedure was performed on
elements.description: The person, animal or group on which the procedure was performed.

constraints.human: All FHIR elements must have a @value or children

elements.name: encounter
elements.description: The Encounter during which this Procedure was created or performed or to which the creation of this record is tightly associated.

constraints.human: All FHIR elements must have a @value or children

elements.name: performed[x]
elements.description: Estimated or actual date, date-time, period, or age when the procedure was performed.  Allows a period to support complex procedures that span more than one date, and also allows for the length of the procedure to be captured.

constraints.human: All FHIR elements must have a @value or children

elements.name: recorder
elements.description: Individual who recorded the record and takes responsibility for its content.

constraints.human: All FHIR elements must have a @value or children

elements.name: asserter
elements.description: Individual who is making the procedure statement.

constraints.human: All FHIR elements must have a @value or children

elements.name: performer
elements.short: The people who performed the procedure
elements.description: Limited to "real" people rather than equipment.

constraints.human: All FHIR elements must have a @value or children

elements.name: id
elements.description: Unique id for the element within a resource (for internal references). This may be any string value that does not contain spaces.

elements.name: extension
elements.description: May be used to represent additional information that is not part of the basic definition of the element. To make the use of extensions safe and manageable, there is a strict set of governance  applied to the definition and use of extensions. Though any implementer can define an extension, there is a set of requirements that SHALL be met as part of the definition of the extension.

constraints.human: All FHIR elements must have a @value or children
Must have either extensions or value[x], not both

elements.name: modifierExtension
elements.short: Extensions that cannot be ignored even if unrecognized
elements.description:
May be used to represent additional information that is not part of the basic definition of the element and that modifies the understanding of the element in which it is contained and/or the understanding of the containing element's descendants. Usually modifier elements provide negation or qualification. To make the use of extensions safe and manageable, there is a strict set of governance applied to the definition and use of extensions. Though any implementer can define an extension, there is a set of requirements that SHALL be met as part of the definition of the extension. Applications processing a resource are required to check for modifier extensions.

Modifier extensions SHALL NOT change the meaning of any elements on Resource or DomainResource (including cannot change the meaning of modifierExtension itself).

constraints.human: All FHIR elements must have a @value or children
Must have either extensions or value[x], not both

elements.name: function
elements.description: Distinguishes the type of involvement of the performer in the procedure. For example, surgeon, anaesthetist, endoscopist.

binding.description: A code that identifies the role of a performer of the procedure.

constraints.human: All FHIR elements must have a @value or children

mapping.map: Some combination of STF-18 / PRA-3 / PRT-4 / ROL-3 / ORC-12 / OBR-16 / PV1-7 / PV1-8 / PV1-9 / PV1-17 / OBX-25

elements.name: actor
elements.description: The practitioner who was involved in the procedure.

constraints.human: All FHIR elements must have a @value or children

elements.name: onBehalfOf
elements.short: Organization the device or practitioner was acting for
elements.description: The organization the device or practitioner was acting on behalf of.

constraints.human: All FHIR elements must have a @value or children

elements.name: location
elements.description: The location where the procedure actually happened.  E.g. a newborn at home, a tracheostomy at a restaurant.

constraints.human: All FHIR elements must have a @value or children

elements.name: reasonCode
elements.description: The coded reason why the procedure was performed. This may be a coded entity of some type, or may simply be present as text.

binding.description: A code that identifies the reason a procedure is  required.

constraints.human: All FHIR elements must have a @value or children

elements.name: reasonReference
elements.short: The justification that the procedure was performed
elements.description: The justification of why the procedure was performed.

constraints.human: All FHIR elements must have a @value or children

elements.name: bodySite
elements.description: Detailed and structured anatomical location information. Multiple locations are allowed - e.g. multiple punch biopsies of a lesion.

binding.description: Codes describing anatomical locations. May include laterality.

constraints.human: All FHIR elements must have a @value or children

elements.name: outcome
elements.description: The outcome of the procedure - did it resolve the reasons for the procedure being performed?

binding.description: An outcome of a procedure - whether it was resolved or otherwise.

constraints.human: All FHIR elements must have a @value or children

elements.name: report
elements.short: Any report resulting from the procedure
elements.description: This could be a histology result, pathology report, surgical report, etc.

constraints.human: All FHIR elements must have a @value or children

elements.name: complication
elements.description: Any complications that occurred during the procedure, or in the immediate post-performance period. These are generally tracked separately from the notes, which will typically describe the procedure itself rather than any 'post procedure' issues.

binding.description: Codes describing complications that resulted from a procedure.

constraints.human: All FHIR elements must have a @value or children

elements.name: complicationDetail
elements.short: A condition that is a result of the procedure
elements.description: Any complications that occurred during the procedure, or in the immediate post-performance period.

constraints.human: All FHIR elements must have a @value or children

elements.name: followUp
elements.description: If the procedure required specific follow up - e.g. removal of sutures. The follow up may be represented as a simple note or could potentially be more complex, in which case the CarePlan resource can be used.

binding.description: Specific follow up required for a procedure e.g. removal of sutures.

constraints.human: All FHIR elements must have a @value or children

elements.name: note
elements.description: Any other notes and comments about the procedure.

constraints.human: All FHIR elements must have a @value or children

elements.name: focalDevice
elements.description: A device that is implanted, removed or otherwise manipulated (calibration, battery replacement, fitting a prosthesis, attaching a wound-vac, etc.) as a focal portion of the Procedure.

constraints.human: All FHIR elements must have a @value or children

elements.name: id
elements.description: Unique id for the element within a resource (for internal references). This may be any string value that does not contain spaces.

elements.description: May be used to represent additional information that is not part of the basic definition of the element. To make the use of extensions safe and manageable, there is a strict set of governance  applied to the definition and use of extensions. Though any implementer can define an extension, there is a set of requirements that SHALL be met as part of the definition of the extension.

constraints.human: All FHIR elements must have a @value or children
Must have either extensions or value[x], not both

elements.short: Extensions that cannot be ignored even if unrecognized
elements.description:
May be used to represent additional information that is not part of the basic definition of the element and that modifies the understanding of the element in which it is contained and/or the understanding of the containing element's descendants. Usually modifier elements provide negation or qualification. To make the use of extensions safe and manageable, there is a strict set of governance applied to the definition and use of extensions. Though any implementer can define an extension, there is a set of requirements that SHALL be met as part of the definition of the extension. Applications processing a resource are required to check for modifier extensions.

Modifier extensions SHALL NOT change the meaning of any elements on Resource or DomainResource (including cannot change the meaning of modifierExtension itself).

constraints.human: All FHIR elements must have a @value or children
Must have either extensions or value[x], not both

elements.name: action
elements.description: The kind of change that happened to the device during the procedure.

binding.description: A kind of change that happened to the device during the procedure.

constraints.human: All FHIR elements must have a @value or children

mapping.map: .inboundRelationship[typeCode=SUBJ].source[classCode=OBS, moodCode=EVN, code="procedure device action"].value=:procedure device action codes

elements.name: manipulated
elements.description: The device that was manipulated (changed) during the procedure.

constraints.human: All FHIR elements must have a @value or children

elements.name: usedReference
elements.description: Identifies medications, devices and any other substance used as part of the procedure.

constraints.human: All FHIR elements must have a @value or children

elements.name: usedCode
elements.short: Coded items used during the procedure
elements.description: Identifies coded items that were used as part of the procedure.

binding.description: Codes describing items used during a procedure.

constraints.human: All FHIR elements must have a @value or children
